text: EXP-561US 3362878 - Pharmaceutical compositions and methods utilizing substituted bicyclo[2.2.2]-octanes is an investigational drug that acts as an inhibitor of the reuptake of serotonin, dopamine, and norepinephrine. It was developed in the 1960s by Du PontUS Patent 3308160 - PHENYLBICYCLO[Z.Z.Z]OCTANE-L-AMINES AND SALTS THEREOF and was suggested as a potential antidepressant but failed in trialsINTERNATIONAL REVIEW NEUROBIOLOGY, Volume 12 Page 160 and was never marketed. ==References== Category:Amines Category:Antidepressants Category:Serotonin-norepinephrine- dopamine reuptake inhibitors Category:Stimulants Category:Experimental drugs
title: EXP-561
